document_title: Prostate cancer: Causes, signs and treatments
subsection_name: ung-thu-tuyen-tien-liet.json_3_Symptoms and signs of prostate cancer
subsection_content:
Common factors causing clinical urinary symptoms are the growth of prostate cancer that blocks urine circulation and bladder obstruction.
Patients with urinary disorders: feeling of incomplete urination, residual urine after urination; The urine stream is weak, not as strong as before; Urinary incontinence, acute urinary retention, frequent urination at night; Urine has blood...
Signs of cancer are completely different from benign prostate tumors, when cancer cells have spread or metastasized: spine pain, pelvic pain; Bloody ejaculation or sharp pain during ejaculation, Lower extremity edema. Patients may also have kidney failure, weight loss, anemia... so they often go for examination to other specialists.
